Reviews.Title: “Noisy, dated hotel; mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: Mariana R
Reviews.Content: I don't like giving poor reviews, but unfortunately, this hotel deserves this rating because: - Noise: I had a room facing the courtyard on the 5th floor. Every night some people would go out into the courtyard (even on a school night) around 11PM or midnight and make a complete ruccus for an hour or tow, that would eccho up to my room. It was awful, woke me up and I couldn't fall back asleep - and I'm not a light sleeper! I think those people live in the building and are not guests so you probably won't have better luck than I did. I called the reception multiple times to complain and there was no one there to pick up the phone, even if they claim to have a 24-hour reception. Being a woman alone, I didn't want to go downstairs or scream out the window so I had to suck it up and get no sleep. - The walls are absolutely paper thin and you can hear people walking and clearly make out what they're saying outside your room. That just added to the aggravation. - Although I had a confirmation, they didn't have a room for me when I arrived, which is really annoying. They ended up having to give me their junior suite (where the couch and curtain were stained and one of the phones didn't work). - I felt completely unsafe as this is an apartment building and people just come in and out without having to go through the reception. - My friend booked a promotion where she got a EUR 10 discount on her room. When we got there, the receptionist told us that was a mistake and she shouldn't have been able to get the discount online, but she would honor the offer. Upon checkout, a different receptionist charged her the EUR 10 and said she had to pay it. After putting up a fight, he relented. - The receptionist upon checkout said my credit card hadn't been charged since my room was never booked, and that I should BE HAPPY they gave me the junior suite. It was condescending and irritating. - Not the cleanest place I've been - crud stuck to my feet as I walked on the cold floor or my room. The phone handle was greasy. - The walls were beat up, scuffed up, and covered in plaster in some spots. The door locks on mine and my friend's room stuck and were hard to open. The one good thing about this hotel is the location - minutes from the Vatican - but I think you can probably do better staying at a B&B close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: judfry1
Reviews.Content: The Amalia is in a great location of Rome. The rooms were small but clean. My wife and I booked our room "ensuite", which means we had a bathroom in our room. Downstairs right outside the Amalia is a great place for Italian Cafe. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is superior”
Reviews.Author: Vivian B
Reviews.Content: we stayed here in October 2011 for 5 days, 4 nights before going on a med cruise. The location was perfect -- right in the center of Rome, 10 minute walk to the Vatican, shopping and many restaurants were near by as well. The room we had was VERY small but my cousins room was like a suite for the same price we paid. I mentioned this to the front desk but they were not willing to adjust ours. First come, first serve which i think was very unfair. i would only stay there again if i knew which room i was getting. Other than that, very clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. The daily continental breakfast was decent too. One other problem is that the tv is in italian so if you don't speak the language, which we didn't, don't turn the tv on cause it can be annoying watching it in a language you cannot speak or understand..

Reviews.Title: “Right next to Vatican”
Reviews.Author: The_Wayfarer2
Reviews.Content: Right next to Vatican. Metro stop within 5min walk. Hotel is tastefully decorated. The rooms were large and clean. The elevator is one of those old style, elegant ones where you need to manually close the door - lovely. On the negatives, no complementary toiletries (e.g. shampoo) in the bathroom, dining area for breakfast is a little small and quickly fills up, the service is typically Roman -minimal at best, and certainly not done even the fainest hint of a smile. All in all, for Rome, it is a good hotel, bit pricey - but value for money in not possible Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy Rome See the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: imf8819
Reviews.Content: No frills. Our family 2x Adults and 2x Teenagers, stayed at the Amalia Quad room 18-24 Dec, luckily the driver from the Hotel knew where the Hotel was at otherwise I don't think i would have found it. Staff was very "quiet". If you don't ask for something, they definitely aren't going to come forward and make any recommendations. The room was a little small for 4 people but clean. The Cleaning staff was excellent and helpful. The morning breakfast was pretty good. The lobby staff frequently made me feel like I was a guest and not a paying customer. You have to weigh the decision on staying here because of the location. Great access to the Vatican, Metro and shopping. It looks like the hotel was in the process of starting renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Only location is super”
Reviews.Author: ribarnika
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel first week of December. I booked with DHR hotels , it's the same price that could have paid if I booked straight from the hotel, the only option is that you can cancel if you book with DHR. For sure you will be given a better room if you book straight from hotel cause the room I was given was like a prison cell. As soon as you open the window you will find air-condition units and empty bottles from nearby restaurant. Thats the view you will see nothing else .The only good option is the location, just 5 minutes walk and you are in the Vatican square. The rest is not as you see or read on this hotel. Breakfast is just a normal poor one. Tea and coffee crosaints and powdered juice .

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Valerie5510
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed in April for five days, we oranised a taxi with the hotel to collect us at the aerport and also for the return journey, it cost 42 euro each pay and well worth it.The hotel is in a great location just behind Vatican city we walked to all the various attractions.The hotel is very clean but basic, but then again you only sleep there, I would recommend this hotel and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious room, great location!”
Reviews.Author: toyshop
Reviews.Content: Made a reservation for Double Classic for 2 nights. We arrived early and was pleased to be checked in early. The room was spacious, and clean. The window view from my room wasn't that great though. Distance to Vatican is superb, 10 minutes away, and 5 minutes from Metro. One thing I don't quite like is the staff service. You don't expect super service. To be fair, they do respond to your queries and help honestly when you approach them. It is just that they don't offer you help, make recommendation, or greet you when you leave or return. I would also expect a 3 stars hotel to offer bottled drink in the bar fridge without charge. This is what I experienced in other Italy hotels. I was just told to refer to the charges in the hotel room when I enquired about if the bottled water is chargable. The overall experience wasn't too bad I would say. It will a lot better if the staff can be more responsive and more friendly.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: BubbleSnow
Reviews.Content: very close to metro. walk to the vactican in 5 mins. even it's next to the train track, the windows were sealed great. If you are a healthy person, don't bother going for the breakfast. All they have were cakes and sweet pastries.

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms great location”
Reviews.Author: Warwicker08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here recently on our anniversary trip to Italy. This hotel is a fantastic location. Just a few minutes walk from the Vatican. Close to good restaurants and lots of shopping. We even walked to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps from here. The hotel is modest but seemed clean. The staff is friendly but not overly helpful. They'll answer questions but didn't seem to want to go out of their way. Our room was small and very bare bones. The bed was not very comfortable but we were so exhausted it really didn't matter. Breakfast was fine. Nothing special but definitely edible. Overall we were satisfied with our stay. We knew we were staying at a budget hotel and were realistic with what we were going to get. I'm not sure I'd stay here again but I don't have regrets about staying here this time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice, Rome 2009”
Reviews.Author: PJG49
Reviews.Content: Amalia Hotel, located on via Germanico, meters from metro-bus service, vaticano, shops, resturants. Hospitality was cordial and service was always good. Being an early morning person, 05:00,continental breakfest was good, however, if you wake later it can seem to be disappointing. The staff presents the table setting very nicely, but later in the morning everyone is trying to enter a small room. They do there best, but too many people at the same time can make the service difficult. I chose this Hotel from locating it on a past stay in Rome, was not disappointed with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, kind staff”
Reviews.Author: astrogidget
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the hotel Amalia. At first, there was a discrepancy about the room - we had two adults and a child. We were told that no bed was available for the child - we would have to sleep everyone in a queen bed or everyone in 2 doubles. During that time, a queen and one double in a room became available for more money (20 extra Euro per night). But only for 3 of the nights. We took it. The room was spacious, clean, cool, with a great bathroom. The staff was great! Super withe my 7 year old son. Finally, the 3rd night came - we prepared to move to a 2 double bed and make due. Packing, we were told that they had arranged the reservations so that we could stay in our room. We were thrilled not to have to move!!! One negative: The continental breakfast - served each day - does not have offer enough food. We got there at 9am on the first morning - to find everything but cold cereal gone! Finally, the attendant - who appears about every 30+ showed up with new pastries - only to have all the previous attendees at breakfast literally lunge at the table and take all the good pastries again!! Because there is not enough placed out on the table to begin with....there is this mad rush to get the available food. We felt that this could be avoided - and felt the need to - the next morning - to set our clocks and get up early....JUST to get a decent breakfast. That said, we would gladly stay at the Amalia again. From the taxi driver arranged to pick us up....to the reception who gladly and happily took our bags for safe keeping...and arranged our room situation. Everyone was great! And the television offers BBC news in English. And despite having to pay 5 Euro for each 3 hour session of WiFi....still worth it: Good speed. Good access. So close to Vatican City, as described. SAFE and friendly neighborhood. Blocks from the Metro. Hotel Amalia gets out vote. If we get the chance to return to Rome....we will definitely return to Amalia!

Reviews.Title: “Second time here, will return”
Reviews.Author: ItalianTripper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, convenient, reasonably priced and above all......quiet. The hotel may not have a flash reception but everyone is helpful and considerate. I had asked for two rooms close to each other. This was carefully managed by the hotel and made the trip easier for my novice fellow traveller. Breakfasts are typically Italian so if you are looking for something substantial, you may need a snack later. Bathrooms seem to have been refurbished since my previous visit in 2007 and provide core requirements. Aircon works well. The safe in the room is welcome. The addition of flat screen TV's may cheer those who need TV whilst away from home. Restaurants in vicinity are good quality and boast a local clientele. Its close to the metro Ottaviano, the hotel will arrange taxis at a good rate to/from airports if you need at a good rate and its a short walk to St Peter's and the hop on/off bus stops. No more needed......

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chuck757
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights based on a recomendation. It was very nice and clean. Breakfast was ok could have been better. Only had a few pastrys and cereal along with juice and coffee. The only complaints that i had about this hotel was the air conditioning which barely cooled the room off and didnt really cool us off during the night and the wifi which was supposed to come included with my upgraded room but when i asked the desk they played stupid so i had to pay for it anyway. Location was great and neighborhood was also great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: nels1792
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a father/daughter (16) trip to Rome. We stayed 6 nights at the Amalia. This is an excellent hotel for a first time visitor. I've stayed in many hotels in Europe and this was one of the bigger ones, but my first in Rome (so I'm sure there are others just as good). The size was very comfortable for the two of us. Large bathroom and two twin beds put together. We also had a large closet, desk, refrigerator, lock box and Wifi access. The hotel was very clean and had a friendly staff. We stayed in Rm 504, top floor with elevator access. Stairs were available as well and easy to take luggage up/down if necessary. Breakfast was included and a mix of European/American items. For those using the USO, the hotel is half block away. The Vatican is two blocks away, Metro two blocks and numerous cafes' and restaurants all within a block. The AC worked very well, but night temps allowed us to keep the window open. It did bring in the busy street sounds, but when closed it wasn't a problem, and the fresh evening air was nice for sleeping. Wifi was 5 Euro for 3 hrs...good enough for emailing and light web surfing. Overall, a great hotel and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star - No way !”
Reviews.Author: karimba1
Reviews.Content: Amalia Hotel consider them selves as a 3 star hotel - their website has nice pictures and gives a good impression. But everything is fake... When you arrive you will find that there is not even a proper reception... The hotel is dirty and worn down... Our room 402 had big holes in the walls. Contacted the reception to borrow an iron and board... Sorry sir we don't offer that... A 3 star hotel who does not offer an iron and a board !!! Breakfast is a joke !! Could write a lot more...but I just recommed you to find another hotel as this is just not value for money... Location is there, yes, but there are so many other hotels around - I would try one of them - don't waste time and money on this hotel ! Cheers from The Nielsens

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION FOR THE VATICAN TOUR”
Reviews.Author: Big-Man1951
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for two nights and although the rooms are a little tight, we were very pleased. Friendly staff, good AC, extremely clean and well maintained and located a few blocks from the Vatican and the trains and buses make this a great choice. We would stay here again when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ok, great location & best staff!”
Reviews.Author: Nu327
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a just what you expected as time of booking. A 3 star hotel with clean and functional rooms, breakfast included is ok and the staff is really kind and helpful. Good wifi conection (not free, 5 € for 3 hours, 10 € for 10 hours, all non.consecutives, so you can buy 3 hours and spend it in different days. The best, of course, is the location, just 5 minute walking to Vatican City. Also easy acces to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location......Poor Condition”
Reviews.Author: SouthernGal1
Reviews.Content: We had a six night stay at the Hotel Amaila and was not pleased. To be fair, I will start with the positives related to this hotel. The first is location. Only two blocks from the Vatican, we found this hotel to be a perfect base for our week-long stay in Rome. The neighborhood seemed friendly and Castroni's next door was a very nice stand-up lunch counter with excellent sandwiches at a good price (which was hard to find in Rome). On the other side of the hotel was a small vendor where we could buy bottled water each morning as we left for sightseeing. Secondly, there was a delightful young woman at the desk who was very helpful and cheerful. I asked that they accomodate us with an early breakfast on a couple of mornings (since our sightseeing departure was prior to the normal breakfast time) and she was happy to help us in that regard. Additionally, she answered any questions we had and didn't give us the impression that we were a bother to her. This hotel needs to be renovated. The carpet in our room was dirty (needed to be vaccumed) and had stains. The tiny bathroom had mold/mildew stains in the toilet bowl, on the wall near the ceiling and in the corners of the showwer. The bathroom needed a good scrub and disenfectant to remove the mildew. The first night, I called the front desk to inquire as to why our television was not working. The male desk clerk came to our room (he didn't appear to be happy regarding this imposition) and after some time discovered that a connection was unplugged. I then asked him for the numbers for English channels. After a considerable amount of time surfing the channels, he said he didn't know. A couple of days later, I called the front desk and asked again and was told they didn't know. After asking again, I was told that when they have a storm, the digital channel numbers change and they didn't know the English channel numbers (highly suspect explanation). So, we were not able to watch TV during our entire stay at Hotel Amaila. The first night, there was an incredible stench in the hallway outside of our room. I was not able to determine the source, but, fortunately it went away and we didn't have to deal with that again. We ran out of toilet paper on two ocasions during this stay. The third day, we came back from sightseeing to find that our door was left ajar (preseumably by the chamber maid). I called the front desk to report this to no real response. Two days later, we came back at the end of the day and again, our door was ajar. This contributed to my feelings of not feeling safe at this property. Fortunately, nothing was stolen from our room. The breakfast provided was marginal. There were plenty of breads and sweets along with coffee/tea. The meat provided was thinly sliced ham that tasted like it was from a can. The cheese was plastic wrapped slices. There was little to no variation from day to day. For the price I paid to stay at this hotel, the breakfast should have been better. The morning of our departure the power went out while we were getting ready to go to the airport. I called the front desk and apparently a breaker had been tripped. Thankfully power was restored. The room was small and the bathroom was micro-size. I was told prior to going to Rome to greatly reduce my expectations as compared to American hotels. Based on the price we paid (which in the US would have easily provided a room at a five-star hotel), I just could not bring myself to reconcile the price versus the condition of this property. I was disappointed with this stay and it was really the only significant negative related to our trip to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “ordinary”
Reviews.Author: Angelrah79
Reviews.Content: this hotel had a great location - very close to the Vatican, public transport and some good restaurants and right next door to a great coffee bar. However, the service was utterly impersonal, and the included breakfast downright terrible - try carbonated orange juice fresh from the machine, which tasted like a Berocca vitamin supplement, or the plastic covered cheese slices. I didn't even bother after the first morning. although our room was large the shower in the bathroom for some inexplicable reason was half the size of a standard shower stall - given that my husband is a big guy, this really did matter to us. there was also a terrible smell in the room every time we entered - we quickly worked out why the cleaner opened the window each morning... I would not go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - great value and top location!!”
Reviews.Author: 19ruprect73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in Hotel Amalia for 4 nights at the end of March 2011. It was our first time in Rome so we were a little unsure of finding the hotel - not to worry, it was 5 minutes walk from the metro station and a large road junction where several bus routes terminated. Cross the main road and you are quite literally in the Vatican City - great location. The hotel was very very clean - some of the whitest sheets I've ever seen! The room had a king size bed which we weren't expecting - nice surprise - and was well equipped with double wardrobe, ensuite shower/toilet, TV, minibar and a safe which was free of charge. The breakfast room was light and airy and the breakfast very fresh - good selection of cereals, breads, pastries, fruit, tea, coffee etc. The best part for us was the hotel staff. They were among the friendliest people we have met on any of our travels. They helped us with transport questions and tourist advice, as well as having a laugh and joke or two with us. Very, very nice people. We will definitely be back to Rome again and will be staying in Hotel Amalia when we return. Thankyou very much for a great hotel experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, perfect for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Monkey6870
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms at this hotel and loved it. The rooms were lovely and clean and the breakfast was very good. Its in a great location to see the Vatican and near the Metro to go off sightseeing. Its near some lovely cafes and restaurants too. The female receptionist was on duty most of our time there and she was very helpful and spoke good English. We've been to Rome twice now so may not return just because we have been there and done that but I would stay at this hotel if we did and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION,CLEAN,NICE,VALUE4MONEY!”
Reviews.Author: Pike2011
Reviews.Content: I was there Feb2011.The Hotel is situated near Vatican City n a couple o blocks of Snt Peter Church.It is nearby Metro station ,Bus station n many Shops.Hotel is Clean ,Great Value 4 money,nice beds.I recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, friendly, well located and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: OttawaTraveller002
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in the fall of 2009. I was in a single room classed as a green room. It was very clean, quiet, comfortable and quite spacious. The staff are very friendly. I thought it excellent value for the money charged. The hotel is very central to the Vatican and its Museums and the Rome metro system is just a couple of blocks away to get everywhere else quickly. The local neighbourhood has many shops and restaurants which solves the problem of no restaurant in the hotel for evening meals. Continental breakfast is included. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved everything, except the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: anne_flute
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel. We had a very comfortable room facing on an inner courtyard, which is much quieter than the rooms on the street (my daughter and her husband found their room noisy with street sounds). The mattress was more comfortable than my mattress at home, and we had a little dressing area as well as an oversized bathroom. (My daughter's room was smaller, with a smaller bathroom, but still very pleasant.) We loved the location, on a side street near the Vatican, and got to know the neighbourhood, since we stayed for a while. It's next door to Castroni, a cafe and food/wine store where it was fun to shop, and there is an inexpensive internet cafe down the block. We found a number of good restaurants in the area. The staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful, especially Leonardo and Maria. Thanks very much for excellent service. Our only disappointment was the breakfast. It's served from 7-9:30 am in a pleasant room, but the selection was very limited: cereal flakes, plain rolls, and various extremely sweet pastries. There were jams, honey, and one kind of soft cheese. The coffee was a major letdown. It tasted so awful that after a few tries I gave up and switched to tea, and this is the land of excellent coffee! We got in the habit of going to a great coffee shop down the block on Ottaviano each morning after leaving the hotel. My daughter has celiac disease (cannot digest gluten) and there was almost nothing she could have at the breakfast. The first day, she had 2 bowls of hot milk with honey. After that we found a grocery store, and brought fresh fruit, yogurt, muesli, raisins, and gluten-free bread with us to breakfast. My suggestion for the hotel would be, please add some fresh fruit, yogurt, maybe boiled eggs, and gluten-free bread (restaurants have it) to your offerings. Perhaps extend the breakfast hours to 10 am, since almost everyone seemed to rush in after 9. And please, please, brew some good coffee! Mille grazie!! I would love to stay here again, especially if these changes were made.

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nesrin_10
Reviews.Content: This is the second time to stay in Amalia Hotel in Rome, it is great and friendly hotel. The staff was very helpful and provided me with lots of information and recommendation and it was great. The location is fantastic, there are many local resturants around it with home made food. You can go shopping, and the best part, it was two blocks from the Vatican. I love this hotel and I will always stay there when go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: akey1101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for six nights. July is probably Rome's busiest month, and the Amalia is located across the Tiber from most of the main tourist. areas, so it was a little quieter, which was nice in the evenings. It was great to be so close to the Vatican, though, and Line A is only about 2 blocks down from the hotel, which will take you pretty much anywhere else you want in the city. The Amalia was exactly what we expected from a Roman hotel. The room was small, with a queen-sized bed taking up most of the room. There was also a desk, a wardrobe, and a flat-screen TV mounted on the wall. The large window looked down on the street. We were on the second floor, which meant we didn't need to use the rickety elevator very often. The bed only had two pillows, but was surprisingly comfortable, and we got some of the best sleep of our vacation there despite the jetlag. The bathroom was probably the most disappointing aspect of the hotel. It had a toilet, duvet and sink. The shower was tiny with a plastic wrap-around door that leaked a bit, and there wasn't great water pressure. The breakfast nook was very typical, with coffee, juices, pastries, bread and cheese. The staff there and elsewhere in the hotel was always wonderful and attentive. They gave us some excellent recommendations for stores and restaurants. The internet is pretty expensive, so we always used a nearby internet cafe. Likewise calls to the US--they weren't outrageous but we could make them much cheaper just down the block. Overall, we had an excellent stay here. It's very basic, but that's all we were looking for--the main draw is obviously this remarkable city. It was a great way to end our days, and I would definitely use it again if I returned to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Clean and Comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: sage09
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April 2010 in a single room. No problems with the hotel at all. Unless you're prepared to fork out mega bucks, Italian hotel rooms are basic anyway. These rooms were fine- clean and comfortable. Breakfast was great. Staff were friendly and helpful. WiFi is available in the rooms at a cost of €5 per 3 hours. Bathroom was clean. The only minor negative was that the shower is cramped. But since that impacts only 4 minutes of the day it's not a concern. I would definitely return to this hotel. It's a couple of minutes away from the Vatican and Metro Ottaviano.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended Hotel - Cheap and very Cheerful ! I would use again”
Reviews.Author: darylclonic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in March 2010 for a two night break. Arrived at the hotel at around 11.00 am and was allowed to check in and given the key to our room (very nice of them as check in is not usual til after 2.00!) and were lucky enough to have a room with a view of the Vatican. Yes the rooms are very basic but certainly had all you needed for a short break (wardrobe, queen size bed, mini bar etc). The room itself was very clean and the same for the bathroom. The breakfast was croissants, cakes, cereal etc and you had the choice of orange juice, tea and coffee. It was fresh and set you up for the day. The hotel is situate a very short walk from the Vatican with restaurants and shops nearby. I would recommend getting the bus to the colloseum at the top of the road (1 euro). We got the bus there and walked back taking in the sites of the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps etc. If you want to stop off for coffee, stand at the bar for only 1 euro (if you sit down at the table this rises to 3 euros!). I also think the restaurants are more pricey than at home and they also added 7.50 euros service charge. The bar at the bottom of the road by the bus stops charge 6.00 euros for a beer! Obviously you are in a city so expect to pay more. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel. The reception staff were all very helpful giving us all the info we needed to get around. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK location”
Reviews.Author: mani1
Reviews.Content: If you choose to stay at Amalia Hotel. Pay for a room at the 5th floor. We had a rom at 3rd floor. The bath room was in a bad condition. The shower had mold growing and it looked like it had not had a decent cleaning for several years. We complained but nothing happend. Our room faced the main street. The traffic kept us awake alle night, especially the trollies. The room was not soundproof against our neighbour rooms either. You can hear everything that is sad in your neigbours room. The breakfast was poor, only tried that once. The location was fine. The front desk was helpful in recomending restaurants and ordering taxi at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Culys
Reviews.Content: This hotel sits between the Ottoviano/St Peters Metro station and the Vatican, 2 minute walk from each, making it the perfect location for seeing the whole of Rome. Opposite St Peter's square there is a line of bus stops for all the sight seeing buses which we found a great way of getting around. The hotel is basic and amenities are limited, but our room was a good size and clean. Tips: We had a room overlooking Via Ottoviano, and were able to spend time watch the hoards of people go by under our window. Do the full bus tour first to get an idea of where everything is then use the Hop on/off arrangement to get to everywhere. We were also lucky enough to wonder down to St Peters around 4pm after our arrival and got into St Peters Basilica without any queuing at all. Use the little yellow man on Google maps to "Drop onto and look round" the junction of Via Ottoviano and Gremanica and you will see the entrance to the hotel to the left of the Castroni caffe, otherwise it is v difficult to find.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - great location”
Reviews.Author: MJandLontour
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Hotel Amalia and were very satisfied. The location is great, a short walk to the Vatican and only 2 minutes walk to the Ottaviano metro station. Room and bathroom were very modern and clean, TV had a good choice of channels, air con was very effective and reception staff were friendly and helpful. Agreed that the breakfast was not fantastic but it is edible and considering the price of the rooms is sufficient. A good value hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: HKong
Reviews.Content: Cleaniness was terrible - breakfast table cloth not replaced until blotched. Minimal breakfast choices (at least amongst the 6 hotels in other cities we stayed on similar rate). Used towels and beddings were not replaced - replacements on request were torn. Dirty and blocked bath tub to the extent of flooding. No refill of soap and shampoo. Morning call request was unattended to. Hotel in midst of an old building block.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Brilliant Location!”
Reviews.Author: hayleybailey
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a City Break in Rome and was very pleased with our hotel. The Rooms were spotless, and very spacious. The air conditioning was really good (much needed in Rome in August) Didnt have a view of the Vatican which we hoped for but had a view of the street looking down to the Vatican so wasnt too bad. The breakfast on the other hand wasnt brilliant. There were bread rolls that were not very nice, very sugary coissants and cakes, continental hard toast with different jams/cheese etc. Had different cereals but the milk was warm, so each morning I ended up with a coffee and a fruit juice, was dissapointed after visiting Venice the previous year and they had different fruits/meats etc. My only other criticism was that we had the same towels the whole time we were there (5 days) but im sure if we had asked they would have changed them. The best thing about the Amalia was the location. Was a 2 minute walk from The Vatican and was only a 20 minute walk into the centre of Rome. Overall this hotel was more than adequate for us. Spacious adequate rooms, great location, couldnt ask for more for what we paid. Would definatly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: redengland
Reviews.Content: After reading negetive reviews on the hotel,our group were worried about staying at thye hotel. We nead not have worried,the hotel is very well priced and for the locxation very good value.From our rooms were good see St Peter's Dome and the Vatican,not bad for a low budget hotel The reception and entrance is very basic,no big deal it adds to the romantic feel (rome).Rooms basic but clean and the bedding also very clean.Leonardo in the reception very helpful and always a smile for us. I am sure that some rooms may not be upto the mark but ours were.We all all well travelled and did not expect the height of 4 star luxury,but we we very happy with the standard.And a location to dreamfor.

Reviews.Title: “A Amalia”
Reviews.Author: eor40
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location with a five minute walk from the vatian. Now my best tips 1 When doing all the sights do it by getting on and off the METRO for 1 euro (Very easy to find and easy access TO ALL SIGHTS>) 2 Never buy a beer or any drink outside drink at the counter or get it from supermarket, we were charged 10 euro beer and water!!!!!!!!!!!! 3 back streets have good deals for meals 10 euro each for pizza salad and a beer(It was tasty) 4 queues are long go very early (8ish) or 2ish 5 ice cream is delicious at the bootom of the stree its called BLUE ICE 6 there is a mini fridge we used it for are beer and are water and the hotel did not mind big bonus 6 breakfast is cakes and coffee cereals and its fine its enough to do you So have a good time any hints or tips just email me. enjoy

Reviews.Title: “10 minute walk to the Vatican and St. Peter's”
Reviews.Author: raraSoCal
Reviews.Content: Amalia had the most perfect location for us. It was a 10 minute walk to the Vatican and St. Peter's, 15 minute walk to Castel Saint Angelo and a 5 minute walk to the subway on Ottavian which would take you to all the great spots like Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza Del Popolo, Colloseum, Palantine Hills, etc... We walked to St. Peter's everyday to start off our sight seeing day. Since Amalia was so close to the subway, I would recommend purchasing a Roma Pass (23E) which is good for 3 days of unlimited subway use and free access to Colloseum and Palantine Hills (12E) and Borghese Museum (12E). The room was small, but we were barely there. The bed was comprised of 2 twins to make a full/queen, but it was surprisingly comfortable and firm and we didn't feel the divide in the middle. The bathroom was small, but functional, and the showers were powerful and temperature sensitive. They didn't provide any shampoo and soap, but we just had to ask them for it. They had internet for 5E for 3 hours through the use of a card. We stayed in room 112 where the connection was bad, so we used our laptop and internet during breakfast where the connection in that room was better. The front desk was nice and helpful. The breakfast buffet was fine for a European Breakfast... cereal, croissants, bread, cakes, coffee, orange juice... nice way to start the day. Amalia was not glamourous, but it was perfect for us and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: CanadaBunky
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amalia for 4 nights. We found the hotel to be quiet and clean. The airconditioner was great. The front end staff was pleasant and helpful, they answered our questions about the tours that were offered. Breakfast was buns and cereal and cakes, this was the typical breakfast we found at all the Italy citys we stayed at. They do not have the big continental breakfasts like in Canada and the U.S. We found we could walk to all the monuments with ease. We were a block from the metro which was very easy to use. There is a great corner store under the hotel for water and everything else. If you are traveling to Europe thinking your getting the big fancy hotels like in Canada and the U.S. your not. The hotels are smaller and more simple, but we found this hotel to be very clean.

Reviews.Title: “great location, surly concierges”
Reviews.Author: astraAustin_TX
Reviews.Content: We were at the Amalia for four nights. All of the men working the front desk were surly. They did give us wakeup calls, and arrange our airport transportation, grudgingly. I felt that I was annoying them with any question or request. Our room was clean and spacious, but had dirty wallpaper, spots on the ceiling, just a shower and no bathtub, bed linens that have seen better days, a tv with no knobs and remote that was barely holding together. My sister had a room (for the same price) that was like a different hotel - nice wallpaper, bathtub, and flat screen tv. So, if you book a room there, make sure it is one of the superior rooms, not the standard.

Reviews.Title: “very clean rooms and so close to the vatican”
Reviews.Author: tweetypie009
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel, its location to the vatican means that you dont have far to walk in order to enjoy the delights of st peters square both at night or during the day. the hotel is very close to the metro stop and is a ver well serviced system. we stayed at the amalia for two nights. the rooms were spotless and the staff were very pleasant and helpful. the only downside that we saw in this hotel was the breakfasts, one morning we discovered that there wasnt much for eating, however the next moring it was a bit better. nevertheless if you are not impressed by what they have to offer, there are many beautiful cafes near the hotel where you should be able to get something. This hotel due to its quiet location is very safe and is not disturbed by any traffic noise. the rooms are well air conditioned and have safes. a perfect hotel for a long or short stay.

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ellenr80
Reviews.Content: Hotel Amalia was a great place to start our trip! The front desk was so helpful and willing to do anything for us! The hallways were generally quiet and clean. Our room was very roomy and the air conditioner worked like a charm, which is invaluable in Rome! The bathroom was nice. Small shower, but that comes with the territory in Italy. Good location. Situated near the Vatican and metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely average, but adequate”
Reviews.Author: CarlisleFJ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this Hotel (room 313), this week Jun-09 and feel that it was a nice place with some shortcomings. Cleanliness was OK, but not perfect. usually a sign that the staff are not given enough time rather than a lack of diligence. Dust was collecting under the bed when I checked just before leaving. The shower was rather old and stained but very effective. Towels were changed daily but the consumables were not replenished. Location: The location is really, really good. about 200 mtrs south of Ottaviano San Pietro Metro Station. and about 500 mtrs north of St Peters Square. The rooms: were a little smaller than you would like, for the money - £100 per night. also they were quite basic, with just a dining type chair to sit on, a wardrobe two bedside tables with lamps and twin beds. There was a mini-bar with all the normal contents. Only one pillow when we checked in and another was not available until the next day. The bathroom sink lacked a plug but, again, one was supplied, the day after one was when requested. The windows were double glazed, so noise was not a problem and the air-conditioning was effective. Service: As we were staying on a B & B basis the only meal was breakfast which was pretty dismal. No fresh fruit, No fresh meat, No toaster and all the bread rolls seemed to be hollow. A lot of cake was available. The cereals were not to our tastes but some may have found them completely acceptable. As with most European hotels No coffee was provided in the rooms Any verbal communications were dealt with in a friendly and manner. Value: As mentioned earlier, the price was a bit on the high side for the standard, but overall taking location, mostly, into account, I feel that the scales were pretty evenly balanced. I would recommend this hotel to a friend but with qualifications. then they can make their own minds up.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Amalia”
Reviews.Author: Saorise
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Amalia Hotel in July 2008 for the third time. I thought I posted a review then but it doesn't seem to have made it onto the review section, this also has happened with Naples review that I wrote in Oct, I must be doing something wrong. For my third visit, the Amalia did not disappoint and I would recommend anyone to stay there. I always stay in a Superior room and have never found fault with them. The breakfast is a continental buffet serving brioche, bread rolls, cereal, juice, coffee etc and this was perfectly adequate for me. I plan to return to Rome again in Sep 2009 and will be booking the Amalia again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value room in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: omareliwi
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with this hotel. We booked 4 nights for £228 via hotelconnect.co.uk ( they had a promotion on for 4 nights for the price for 3) - which is excellent value for a good location in Rome. When we arrived there was some big maintenance works going on in the small reception area, but we were greeted by a very friendly woman who spoke good English. We checked into room 404 which we were very happy with the size of. Very clean, and the twin beds put together were large and comfortable ( the beds are quite hard, but we didnt mind that at all). It had a good view of the hustle and bustle of the street from the window. I see what people mean about the showers being hard work ( it is a tiny cubicle) , but once you get used to it and you arent too big a person, its OK and shoots water out very powerfully. Breakfast was for the sweet toothed with a lot of cake, some cheese and break and had excellent coffee and orange juice. Not to sound too much like Alan Partridge describing the Travel Tavern he used to stay in, but the Genius of this hotel is in its location. It is 2 blocks away from a metro station ( Ottaviano S. Pietro, only 5 stops from Termini), and a little over a 5 minute walk to the Vatican. Brilliant. The neighbourhood is very nice, with lots of restaurants in the area offering good lunch time deals ( pick up some fliers near the Vatican Museums). Only word of caution is DO NOT GET A TAXI from Termini station to the hotel. A woman that we met shortly after checking in got stung for 45 Euros to get her elderly father and herself a taxi to the hotel. Unbelievable, especially considering that taxi's directly from Ciampiano airport to City Centre hotels cost a fixed rate of 30 Euros. My wife and I got the metro directly from Termini to the hotel for 1 Euro each. And one tip - for those interested in good "gelateria" - visit the parlour directly opposite the hotel entrance on the corner ( it will have a massive multi coloured plastic ice cream cone outside). Excellent ice cream, and the very friendly man that runs the place makes your day. He speaks excellent English and is a bit of a character.

Reviews.Title: “a solid room near the vatican and metro line”
Reviews.Author: chris1999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit out of the way. It's also a bit of a trip from the train station. (pretty much every hotel is a trip from the airport) it is also easy to miss but our taxi had no problem finding it. I think it cost 15 euro to get there from the train station. The metro line is two blocks away. very convenient. use it. within a stones throw of the vatican and the papal apartments. I could see st peters dome from the hotel room window. the street below is loud the room is very clean and almost elegant looking the staff is nice, but some dont speak much of anything but italian. not a negative, just an observation. i had to check out at 4 am and get a taxi. my italian wasnt all that good and his english was even worse. we both made it work though. breakfast is pasties, cereal, tea, burnt coffee (if you get there late) the pastries were good though. good restaurants nearby so i would never have eaten in the hotel restaurant. lots of gelaterias too. very out of the way for things like trevi fountain, colosseum, etc, but easy to get to using the subway. hotel seems to be in what is an apartment complex. there is a wire elevator cage. it was never an issue though. Subway is clean and efficient. sometimes crowded. but better than NYC

Reviews.Title: “great location, erratic stay, not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Riazat
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome for one week for work reasons and chose this hotel for no particular reason. The hotel shares the building with private apartments and offices. At first they put me in a ground floor room which had no natural light, stank of cigarettes, had bad air conditioning and mites in the bed. I got bitten the first night I was there and kept awake by the sound of people going in and out (you need to use a buzzer to come in). I complained and then got moved to a deluxe room which was way better - great windows, clean furniture, spacious and cooler. But it still cost E125 a night (this was in September). The room is ok, it's fine. It's about 45 seconds to St Peter's Square, it's within three or four minutes walk of two different subway stations, there are lots of places to catch taxis and eat food. So in location terms it's amazing. If you're a walker, like I am, you can get to Piazza Navona/Coliseum/Trevi Fountain in about 20 minutes max. But if you're working it's the little things that stress you out - like how there's no wifi even though it's advertised on the hotel website. The shower has a deeply unpleasant corrugated plastic door that is plain cheap, there is no laundry or room service, the breakfast sucks. I heard good things about the Atlante Star and the Hotel Torre Argentina though.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, I'd go there again!”
Reviews.Author: LoonySwiss
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this hotel based on the good reviews, and we were not disappointed at all. The Amalia is a great hotel. We stayed there for four nights in hot and sunny August. It's in a perfect location, just a few minutes walk from the Underground line A, which leaves from Termini railway station (which is where you end up when you come from the aiport and take the Leonard Express train into Rome). It's in a very nice area of Rome, only a few minutes walk to the Vatican museums. When we got there in the morning our rooms weren't ready but we could store our luggage in a safe place. We got a Superior Room, on the top floor, with a good view to the dome of St. Peter. The room was quiet, there was a very good air conditioning system (you need to pay that extra, but it's worth it in summer) and it was spotlessly clean - I liked the fact that the floors were stone, and not carpet, it's a lot cleaner! We loved the old-fashioned lift; we loved the breakfast buffet, which gave us everything we needed, although it is a bit on the sweet side and there's no cheese or ham or fruits, but croissants,bread, sweet, dry cakes and cereals - and one of the best coffees I've ever had. The staff were always very friendly, they even helped us when we had a request for a booking of a special sight-seeing. They speak English fluently, too. All in all: don't look for another hotel, go to the Amalia, it's a great experience! And, there's a nice restaurant just round the block (out of the hotel, to the left, then left again and it's on the right side of the road), called the Isola della Pizza, which was a great find: good food, not too expensive, wonderful antipasti misti and just lovely sizzling meats.

Reviews.Title: “best location”
Reviews.Author: yorkieinlondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on a b & b basis. the hotel is clean, comfortable and absoultely in a fabulous location for seeing all the best attractions in Rome. On arrival we were warmly greeted and shown to our room. We did upgrade to a room with a "view of the vatican" !. room 504 may have slightly better view. Our room was very clean, comfortable with a very good hot shower. Standard rooms looked decent. just a little smaller than the superior rooms. Breakfast was of the continental type, adequate buffet style including tea/coffee, help yourself to as much as you want. We found all the staff helpful and friendly, especially Maria on reception who was more than happy to give us tourist tips. We had a taxi from Ciampino airport to the hotel it was 47 euros, there is a bus from the airport to centre of rome for just 6 euros they run about every 30 minutes. We did most of our touring on foot, the vatican being just 5 minutes walk away, most other sites are within walking distance. You can purchase a day pass for the metro and local buses they are just 4 euros. We visited the vatican musuems (sistena chapel etc), that was 14 euros and well worth the money, we spent half a day enthralled by the whole experience, there is a portable guide available to hire they are 6 euros they are really useful. Visited the Callisto catacombs the cost was 6 euros it does take up half a day though. One of the best meals we had was in a chinese restuarant called Ni Hao on angolo Piazza just by the vatican city wall well worth the money. There is also a decent Irish bar called The Black duke near the Pantheon that serves good food and beer. There is so much to do and see in Rome it is fabulous, go there and explore it for yourself, enjoy

Reviews.Title: “a week in the Amalia...”
Reviews.Author: JawsOGRE
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week in the Amalia early in October of 2007 with my girlfiend... the location was great. We are very pedestrian / mass transit type people, and the location could not have fit us better. We arrived in Rome from Venice by train, and easily connected from Termini to the subway system, and the hotel is just blocks from one of the stops. It is close enough to walk to downtown Rome, and easily steps from the Vatican. The room was HUGE (in comparison to our rooms in Trieste, Venice, and London). The shower was probably the smallest of any of those places, but the room itself was massive! Breakfasts were filling, and worked well for a day of exploring in Rome. Nothing was overly fancy, but it worked, it was well located, and I would not hesitate to stay again at the Amalia.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Haven!!”
Reviews.Author: FisherPair
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Amalia for about 10 days for our honeymoon and loved it!! We initially chose it due to the proximity to Vatican City/St. Peter's Basilica, and we were so pleased when we got there! Price is reasonable for the size of the room and the location of the hotel. Numerous restaurants within walking distance, metro stop only 2 blocks away. Hotel has guest leave the key to the room at the desk while site-seeing, and housekeeping service was always very prompt, with fresh towels, clean sheets and a clean room. Leonardo was always very friendly and helpful at the front desk, as well as the other staff, whose names we can't remember. Breakfast selections were always very good. They even arranged for a car to pick us up/take us to Fuimicino Airport. It may not be a 5-star hotel, but you do get 5-star treatment!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: davyhodge
Reviews.Content: We went open minded after reading the mixed reviews. The hotel is in an excellant location 5 mins to Vatican and 2 mins to nearest metro. The room we had was very clean with large with ample space and wardrobes. The bathroom was also large but the shower cubicle was small but you could still shower easily. We found the hotel very quiet and the staff very approachable. The staff recommend a restaraunt the next street up but there are very good and cheap eateries in the local area. We tended to select the ones populated by priests and the trainees from the police training centre and we never had a poor meal. Rome itself seemed dirty and smelly and we went in Feb, don't know what it would be like in the stale,hot summer months

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LancashireRadley
Reviews.Content: You cannot fault the location of the Amalia. It's just a few minutes walk to the Vatican, plenty of local shops and restaurants (as used by Italians) plus a short walk to the Metro which can then easily get you to all the other main sites including the Spanish steps, Trevi Fountain, Colloseum, etc. The room we had was small but if you are only using it as a base for sight seeing on a short break then what else do you need. It was clean and had everything we needed (apart from some extra pillows and to be fair we did not ask for more). The reception staff were also helpful and breakfasts were reasonable for continental style.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: vocjewl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed at this hotel in Rome for 7 nights, we were in a standard room for the first 3 nights. While it was very clean, there was no outside view, just a view down into the laundry and the room was very small. However, it was very clean so you could live with it. On the last 4 nights we upgraded to a superior room and the difference in size was amazing, also you could see the top of St. Peters from the window which was nice. I rated the hotel above average as i believe a lot of the budget accommodation in Rome is quite dirty and this hotel was certainly not. The staff were very pleasant and arranged a taxi for us to the airport and kept our bags all day on our departure. For what you pay, the location is excellent, just a short distance from the vatican and then just a minutes walk to the Ottavano metro which you can access all the main attractions. Definately recommond this hotel to anyone who wants a clean, comfortable and easy access base in rome.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: dancingqueen_8
Reviews.Content: We were shocked by this hotel from the minute we arrived at the entrance. There was no signage, and there was not really a front desk - just a bare little cubby hole. The elevator was tiny and old and no one to help you. The rooms were very small, and the hotel was dark. Peeling wall paper, dirty bedspreads, towels thin, mattress just foam on a plank, and awful pillows. Also, most importantly not at all near the Spanish Steps. This hotel is in a grimey location.We did not stay but quickly found another hotel that was less money and considerably more comfortable and in a better location. Hotel Amalia looks nothing like the web site or its brochure.

Reviews.Title: “uneven experience”
Reviews.Author: JimDel10
Reviews.Content: The upgraded room was extremely nice. Very clean, but very cold. When I complained to the front desk, they told me they controlled the heat and that it was functioning. Sure didn't feel like it. The front desk was not helpful at all. They missed a wakeup call, and when I called the front desk and no one answered for over 5 minutes, I went downstairs only to find the front desk person standing outside smoking a cigarette and talking to a friend. The location was great and it was absolutely quiet. Close to the Metro and the Vatican. I guess if it's not too cold out and you don't need any help from the staff, the Amalia would be an OK place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Hotel Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ksmiffy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of July, booked through the Easyjet website when booking flights - fairly last minute and for what we considered a very good price. Having checked out the hotel's website before we left, I was surprised to be allocated on arrival, a room on the 3rd floor that was about the size of a cell. I'm not exagerrating, I felt claustrophobic and knew immediately we could not comfortably spend 5 nights in it. Fine if it was a single room with a single bed for single occupancy but the double bed took the biscuit - there literally was not enough room to shimmy around it. I called reception, explained we were not satisfied and asked if we could see another room. After a bit of humming and hawing from the guy on the desk, I mentiond that I'd noticed that they advertised superior rooms on their website and that we would be willing to pay a supplement should one of those rooms be available. We were shown to a decently sized twin room but told that it could only be for one night and they would have to reallocate us the following day. This was fine, just wanted out of that room as soon as possible! As it turned out the next day we were told that we could stay in the room for the remainder of our stay (5 nights) at an extra 50E per night. A good result and still what we considered to be good value for money. The room itself had air con, a window (the other room didn't adding to the closed-in feeling), tv with satellite channels (not important but background noise in the morning to help wake up!), a safe, mini bar and a good size bathroom with bidet, and shower over bath. Always plenty hot water - no complaints there. Housekeeping was good and thorough. We never bothered with breakfast in the hotel but did stop by at the Cafe Castroni just downstairs from the hotel most mornings - it was a nice spot to sit outside and fuel up before heading on our daily adventures. The hotel was v. handy for, as well as St. Peter's and the Vatican, the underground station. Two or 3 stops and you were in the centre of town. Most days we would take the underground in and then meander our way back to the Amalia, taking in the sights on the way. There was a good little bar just around the corner on P. Risorgimento, next to the Irish bar. Another good spot to stop and have coffee or a cold beer and snack, watching the world go by and St. Peter's dome lit up in the evening. We did eat in Il Toscana downstairs from the hotel on one of the nights. This place was always packed and so, being foodies, were keen to try it. Sadly, it was not somewhere I would recommend - the food was great but the haughty and aloof service left a bad taste and we could not leave quickly enough. We got the impression that they did not need nor encourage business from tourists. A place we did eat in that I could not rave about enough was situated just off Via Tritone. Take the metro to Barberini - walk one block down Tritone and then cut in to the left onto a cobbled street with a church as though heading towards the Trevi Fountain. The restaurant was on the left hand side with a good size dining area outside underneath a canopy. Unfortunately we didn't get the name but dined there 2 nights in a row - their smoked mozzarella stuffed with mushrooms and olives was to die for!! A taxi into town in the evening never cost more than 10E - including tip. Beware, though, one night (a Sunday) we went to take a taxi back and before we got in the driver said 20E before the meter starts. We questioned it and he got irate saying that it was Sunday and therefore a holiday, citing "maybe in your country .... blah". We didn't hang about. Walked up to the main stance at Barberini and checked with another driver who confirmed that he was blatantly trying to rip us off. Almost but thankfully we were not victim to this rip-off merchant but asI say, watch out, because he did look completely legit. The other driver we told took a note of his number as he was still sitting at the corner when we went by. Back to the hotel ... On the day of departure, we had an evening flight and so enquired a couple of nights before whether a late check-out would be possible and how much it would be. We were quoted 50E and in the end decided not to bother because, as we explained to the front-house manager, it really was just to come back after a last day of sight-seeing for a shower before our flight. As it transpired, on the morning of check out. a different member of staff told us we could leave our luggage in a room on the second floor and to feel free to use the shower and changing facilitie next to the breakfast room. Result - what a handy thing and had we known we wouldn't even have enquired about the late check-out. Am sure the other member of staff could've told us about this but there did seem to be abit of an indifferent attitude from most of the team. Rounding up, I would say that I might stay here again but perhaps would like to try a different location in the city. This was a good, clean, comfortable base reflecting good value for money (unless you take the first room into account!) and in a good location so if you're not looking for any frills then I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: ScouseTomLiverpool
Reviews.Content: The Amalia is within a five minute walk of St Peters and the nearest metro station. Ideal for seeing all of the sites. 10 minutes on the metro to reach the Spanish steps or the Trevi Fountain area. One change to get to the Colliseum. Don't bother booking a tour for a Papal Audience on Wednesdays. Just go to St Peters for 10:00 am and get a spot near the barriers. See my photo for how close you will be to the Pope. The room was spotlessly clean and the air conditioning was available all of the time. The staff were very helpfull. Breakfast is cerial and cakes, not my ideal breakfast, could be improved with a selection of meats or cheese. Would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: AllisonDay
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 5 day break in Rome, staying at Amalia Hotel. Very good location - not too noisy, but near to metro (very cheap) so you can get anywhere easily. Room clean and nicely decorated. Staff very helpful. Fairly good breakfast choice with nice pastries, and great espresso coffee! Comfy beds, safe, fridge and hairdryer in room. Nice cafe just down the road. You can get coach from airport to the Termini area of Rome (where you can get a free local map) , then hop on metro to Otoviano metro station, and its a short walk from there. Would definately recommend to others and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Prati Area 3 blocks away from St. Peters/Vatican City”
Reviews.Author: CatholicPilgrim
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I stayed here from May 25-June4 2007. We had room 506. This is a very nice hotel, with adequate accommodations and although it has some minor issues I would consider this an excellent place to stay in Rome if your main interest is being close to the Vatican. The positivies: The windows are substantially sound proofed, but this part of the city is NOT noisy. The room is large enough for 2 people to be in the room at the same time with a moderate amount of luggage, and not feel like you want to be alone. We had a large amount of luggage and were able to use the "dead" spaces for storing our suitcases. The bed was hard - which we like, but that's a personal preference. The bathroom was also adequately sized (my spouse and I are not slim) but the shower stall is somewhat small. The hotel staff were very pleasant and put up with our foibles, ie. American Tendency to be direct with a request right after a greeting (Eg. Hello! I need...). Air Conditioning worked very well and was only necessary a few times since we were on the top floor, and there were only 2 hot days. Hotel staff is very friendly and courteous. The negatives: The housecleaning is vague. On the 6th day I had to ask if they were EVER going to change the sheets. I was told the sheets are changed every 3/4 days (very vague). We were there 10 days and they changed the sheets once. Thankfully my spouse and I are very clean people so it wasn't a hardship - I'd watch out on the sheet and towels. There was one day the towels left of the floor were placed back as "clean" on the rack. I complained and received new ones right away. The bathroom fixtures (bidet, basin, toilet and shower) were cleaned every day which is very important to me. The choice of toilet paper brand - well, it was interesting. Seemed to be more air than paper. Querks: Breakfast was okay and adequate. Breads, cereals, prunes, packaged toast, sweetcakes and rolls. If you like hot milk with your coffee (which I do), this was a very nice choice. Choice of orange and pineapple juice and water and milk to drink. Fruit cocktail not a great choice but hey, the breakfast was included with the room. When we took to "old-fashioned" elevator only my husband and I could fit...I'm sure it could hold 5 slim persons, but it was a fun way of getting up 6 flights of stairs. Hanging out the windows on the top floor on the street side was also a cultural experience. This is a residential area with heavy tourist traffic. You can see the gypsy beggars arrive in the morning and "assume their position" which makes them look physically handicapped - they're not. I've watched and seen them "do their work." Don't feel sorry for them. So with all these remarks I would definitely stay here again. I booked online through ghrshotels and compared to the experiences cited here about using other online booking agents, I think it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ItaliaTraveler
Reviews.Content: I've traveled to Rome many times, but this visit was a big disappointment because of this hotel. We arrived around 9:30 p.m. on a Saturday and were shocked to see the room we were given. Weeks before, we had requested on Expedia (and confirmed directly with the hotel via email just 7 days earlier) a double room with two beds, but we were given a very small room and one small bed (it was not a double bed--you could not even place two pillows side by side on it--and it was certainly not the two beds we requested) [room #401]. Inside the room, on the notice giving the maximum price for the room, the only price given was as a single room, confirming our impression that the room was not intended to be a double room. The woman at the desk, while trying to be pleasant, was unhelpful in finding a comfortable solution (options were to get two rooms and pay the difference, or get a room with a bathroom down the hall). When we checked out, the manager would not even talk to us about our complaint, which I thought was highly unprofessional, so I was left to discuss this with the employee at the desk. We were charged for a double room (55 Euros higher per night than the posted maximum charge for the room). After the employee told us there was nothing she could do about the price, which we had agreed to on Expedia, I persisted in saying we hadn't been given what we requested on Expedia, and she finally (after a long and tedious conversation) took a total of 30 Euros off a two night stay. In addition to the uncomfortable room size/bed situation and lack of managerial attention, I would warn people that the hotel wasn't always quiet. The cleaning woman chatted loudly and incessantly on her phone outside our room in the morning. All in all, I cannot recommend this place, and will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shark1117
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first trip to Rome,our stay could not have been better.The Hotel Amalia was perfect staff was very helpfull.made phone calls for us to check on tours & our ride back to airport. Our Room 403 had the largest bed we have ever spept in as i am over 6' 4" had no problem.Bathroom very new and clean little small but worked out ok. Location was perfect just 2 blocks from St Peters & Vatican, the Metro also 2 blocks away.can be at Trevi&Spanish steps Etc in 5-10 min.Have friends going To Rome in Oct would definitely recommend they stay at the Amalia Hotel. Also great Resturants & shops in the area, this hotel was a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and Quiet near the Vatican City”
Reviews.Author: Bobbio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2007, our first visit to Rome. The Amalia is an excellent location for the Vatican City but a bit of a walk or a short taxi or Metro ride to the old city across the river. The rooms were spacious and spotless and the staff very helpful. We stayed in a spacious family room with a large marble shower room. The reception area is a common area with the other residents and businesses that share the same front door and is not always spotless but once inside the hotel area it is perfect. The historic lift (elevator) is an experience in itself, but perfectly safe. Breakfast on the second floor is a little on the sweet side, thay could do with a few savoury things, but for that sort of thing there is a small grocery shop next door, and on the other side a store cum cafe. Very handy to some major shopping streets and a short walk to the Metro. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful room in good location”
Reviews.Author: kittenwarrior
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in the Hotel Amalia. It is in a lovely building and we had a large quiet rooms. The breakfast is absolutely fine and is perfect for those with a sweet tooth. We loved the old fashioned lift. The staff were also very helpful. This is the right place to stay if you want to be near the Vatican etc. The Metro was very near for other parts of the city and most things are accessible on foot. We paid about £40 a night in Jan. Recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Reccomendable”
Reviews.Author: Bikesub
Reviews.Content: We stayed three night in this hotel at the begginning of December. The hotel is quite well located to Vatican City area, but needs a walk to Rome's city centre. The area is half residential half commercial but not crowded. The room we had was very nice considering Rome's standards and prices. Room size was ok, not luxurious but neat and clean, king size bed was two one person beds pulled together but very comfortable. Bathroom was just ok in size and cleanliness though a little strange as it was "buit on purpose" and not part of the original building structure. Reception people were fine, specially friendly the lady in the morning. Breakfast is quite nice for sweet taste as there is no ham or cheese, but with a good supply of pastries and expresso is included if you ask the waiter. Be careful, some rooms we could see from the corridor are significantly smaller and worse than the one we had. We stayed in third floor, right hand room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Scottish_Thistle
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights at the start of Dec and overall we were happy with the quality of the hotel in relation to the money we paid (around €250 for 3 nights). The 3 star rating of the hotel reflects what you get. The hotel is part of an old building, and the hotel accomodation is split across a number of floors, with a number of other small businesses also operating from the same building. As a result of this, the main shared stairwell is a litlle sparse and looks slightly run down. Our room was on the fourth floor and looked pretty much like the images shown on the hotels website. As some others have already commented, the beds are a little on the firm side, but not to the point that it would stop anyone from sleeping after a busy day of sight-seeing! The bathrooms were modern and clean, but the showers are very small (2/3 the size of a normal shower tray). The breakfast provided is VERY basic, a few types of cereal, some tinned fruit, 2-3 types of cake and some bread rolls. However, there are plently of reasonably priced coffee shops close by if you prefer something more substantial. The reception staff were lovely and very helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations, etc. We asked them to book a taxi to take us to the hotel & paid €47, which is possibly slightly more expensive than the same journey in a local white metered cab. The best thing about the hotel is probably it's location, which is in a busy and safe part of town. The hotel is only 5-10 mins walk from the Vatican / Sistene Chapel and about 20 mins walk from the Trevi Fountain or the Spanish Steps. We walked everywhere during our 3 days in Rome and found the city reasonably easy to get around - the hotel will give you a map on arrival. We really enjoyed our trip to Rome and will most likely stay at the Amalia again if we ever return.

Reviews.Title: “Room okay but shower cubicle tiny”
Reviews.Author: Div1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was recommended by Travel Agent. Receptionists were friendly and helpful and it is 5 minutes from St Peters Basilica and Vatican Museum. The room was clean and the king size bed was firm. Although the bathroom was clean there was a very bad smell coming out of the basin and the shower. After my complaint this was sorted out. The shower was the smallest shower cubicle I have ever used! The hole was blocked and even after the problem was raised, it was not resolved to satisfaction. Breakfast was a very good selection of cereals, rolls and croissants and beverages. Hotel recommended a local pizzeria nearby Dino e Vita (I think). This was the worst food we ever had over the 3 days we stayed in Rome. The Margeritta Pizza was soggy with tomatoes and the Fettucinni with Porcini Mushrooms was very salty. The owners did nothing to improve the quality of the food even after complaint. Croydon, Surrey, England

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, friendly staff but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: ableassistant
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and very clean in a good location for the vatican city and museums. Also well located for the metro and had a good restaurant right next door. There were pizza places, shops and coffee shops close by. However we paid £104 per night for a very small double room with no natural light, there was a safe provided in the room free of charge and the bathroom was nice with a good shower but no ventilation. The bed was king size and comfortable but we could not both move around in the room at the same time. Breakfast included in the price which was self service and a good choice of cakes, pastries, cereal etc tea and coffee. I would have rated this hotel higher had the room been a bit larger with some natural light.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: firstson
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Amalia is located within a few blocks of St. Peter's and the Vatican. If you are mainly interested in sight-seeing this is good value for your money. The room was large and clean. (However we did not realize the rate did not include air-conditioning) Luckily, the weather was pleasant and we opened our window to a pleasant breeze. The neighborhood is very quiet at night so there was no problem with noise. The breakfast was very good and the staff, especially Giusy and Maria at the front desk were very helpful arranging trips and airport transportation. I would recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: SallyO
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights over the last weekend in Sept. Booked via Easyjet £406 for a room for 2 including breakfast. Room was small but very clean and well appointed. Hotel reception staff were very friendly and helpful. Location great - very near the Vatican but quiet and residential area at night. Couple of very good neighbourhood restaurants including the Toscana right next door to the hotel. Very near the metro and just 3 stops to the Spanish Steps - just 1 euro ! Our top tip ? Watch out for taxis at Ciampino airport and get a fixed price BEFORE you get in !

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Serval
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a double classic room (one bed) for 4 nights in August at 129 Euro per night including tax, services and buffet breakfast. Front staff helpful and everyone spoke some English. Room and bathroom were spacious and clean. Breakfast was okay, not a big selection, mostly cereals, pastry and bread. Breakfast room is very small, but we went early and always had a table. Hotel is in convenient location, very close to Vatican City and a short walk to buses and trains. FYI, the elevator is very tiny and there is only one. Our room was on the 5th floor, ask for a lower level if you don't want to use the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TBTA
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at the Amalia which we booked online through Easyjet Hotels. At £56 per room per night we were very impressed with what we got. The location was excellent, less than a 5 minute walk to the Vatican and 50 yards to the underground and bus stops to explore Rome. We asked for a quiet room and were put in room 111 which is out the back on the ground floor. There was no view but the room was lovely - quiet and newly decorated. The bathroom looked newly fitted and the room was always cleaned well. Not the largest room but for a city break we were more than happy. The staff were friendly and always willing to help. The only let down was the breakfast which was very limited - cereal, bread rolls, croissant or a variety of cake - fine if you have a sweet tooth!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was wonderful. We would stay there again! We arrived hot and tired from our long trip from the States and Leonardo was there to greet us and make us feel welcome.
