He was very helpful with all our requests, even suggesting a department store close by, and really helped out in attempting to locate our missing luggage. The hotel is located close to the Metro and a short walk to the Vatican. The hotel was clean and very comfortable. It was nice for a family, including a 2 yr old.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: KathieG
Reviews.Content: I visited the hotel with my mother in June. The air con was a blessing as Rome was experiencing very hot weather over 36 degrees. Our room was on the ground level at the back of the hotel which was good as my mother has difficulty with stairs. It was compact but had very pleasant furnishings and a lovely bathroom. The air con kept the room very cool and was on constantly. We had no view and kept the shutters closed. Breakfast was typically continental and adequate for our needs set in a room on the second floor overlooking the main street. All the reception staff were helpful and friendly. We did expereince a down side to Rome via a taxi driver who charged us 40 euros from the Ternini to the hotel which should have cost 15 euros. We used a taxi on the rank with a meter that magically jumped to 36 euros. He didn't have any change so took the 40 euros. Apart from him all other taxi drivers were good and on our return to Termini station it cost 15 euros. Do go on the Tour bus which can be picked up outside St Peters for only 13 euros for the day. Also visit Trastevere district for dinner and the beautiful St Maria's church in the square. Overall a great visit to Rome and I would highly recommend Amalia for anyone wanting to vsit the Vatican as it is only a short distance away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: aburnett95
Reviews.Content: Being American I was a little shocked by the small size of the hotel room at first. But it was in a good location and the help was very pleasant. Clearly as old and small as everything else in Italy. It is a one block walk to the Vatican Museums and two block walk to St. Peter's. There are also several Pizzarias, tratorias, and evetything else right on the same block, including a laundry mat. All in all my stay was very pleasant. The breakfast was mixed breads, spreads, cereals, and coffee, exactly what I expected it to be. Would definetly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GDLEB
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3night stay and have no complaints about this pleasant little hotel.Our 3rd floor rooms were spacious and comfortable as well as having en-suite facilities.Ideally situated for the Vatican we found the staff helpful and knowledgable.After reading the rather poor reports concerning the breakfasts, we were pleasantly surprised to find an adequate selection of cereals,rolls, pastries and juices to see us through to our mid morning coffee break.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rmarten
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amalia for 8 nights in November 2005. I love neighborhood and location of the hotel. It is just a block from the Vatican wall and entrance to the Vatican museum. The lovely ensuite rooms on the upper 3 floors are remodeled and very comfortable. The rooms on the first 2 floors have shared baths are best used by budget travelers. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The breakfasts are some of the sweetest we encountered in Italy. The freshly made cappuccinos made the cakes and doughnuts, yes I said doughnuts, go down a little easier. I would definitely stay at the Amalia again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Amalia”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Hotel Amalia for 4 days and we were pleasantly surprised by our room after having read so many bad reviews regarding mid-priced European hotel rooms. Our room, though small by American standards (which is the case everywhere in Europe) was extremely clean, as was the much larger than expected modern equipped bathroom. The air conditioning unit worked well and didn't cost us extra (it does in ALOT of other Italian hotels). We were quickly supplied with extra towels and pillows as soon as we asked for them. The location is perfect for seeing everything because its right next to the St. Peters Square, which is also the corner where all the major open-top tour busses pickup.The car they arranged for us both to and from the airport was on time and the driver was very friendly, even stopping to let me use an ATM both times. The best thing about our stay was the staff. All of the receptionists were very helpful with all of our questions and requests, especially a young man named Giovanni. He single-handedly made our trip twice as good by helping us with directions, travel advice, helping to arrange various trips, and filling us in on what to watch out for in Rome (ie unofficial taxis requesting outrageous fares etc). Our trip wouldn't have been as enjoyable without his help. I loved the Amalia and will def be staying there again next fall. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because the breakfast buffet was pretty sparse and only served cold bread, but I quickly found out thats the norm in Rome. Luckily there is a little cafe right across from the lobby that serves warm pizza, croissants etc almost 24-7. If you stay there don't miss the Old Bridge Gelateria about 5 min away across from the Vatican. It' s the best gelati in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. The location is perfect, being just a short walk from the Vatican and a Metro. Its is a doddle to get to and from Fiumicino airport and everything you want to see is either a short walk or a few stops away on the Metro. The hotel remarkably looks as per the photos - and it is spotlessly clean. I paid a few sheckles more and booked a double room for single occupancy. Upon check-in, because this is the low season, I even got an upgrade to a superior double room at no extra cost. The staff I found to be very helpful and friendly. The buffet breakfast is a tad basic (rolls, cake, croisants, tea, coffee + juice), but it fills a gap till lunch. Some decent shopping to be done nearby (clothes shops etc) and good restaurants behind the hotel. On the negative side - not much really. The lift is a pain. If a previous user on another floor doesn't close the doors, it just stays there. (It happened twice). But I'd recommend this hotel to any-one wanting a nice, good value, clean, comfortable base from which to see the wonderful sights of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A good base from which to explore Rome”
Reviews.Author: loddington
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January 2005 for a long weekend. As it was on a half-price winter offer I had no complaints about price. There are no public areas, just rooms and a reception desk. The lift is quite old, with a metal grille for the door. The plus points are location, about ten minutes walk from St Peters Square and 15 minutes from the nearest Metro stop [Ottaviano]. The buffet breakfast, with cereals, tea and coffee, cakes, jam, rolls, was very good, nicely served in a separate dining room. Clean room, towels and power shower, and a TV that unfortunately wasn't tuned to an English station, but I had no complaints. A good base from which to explore Rome, especially if you can take advantage of their occasional special offers.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location ... unreliable taxi service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We pre-ordered a taxi with Hotel Amalia to collect us from the airport (and e mailed them the day before to check it was still booked!). Our name was being held by a taxi driver - but he was not for us! He said our driver would be 10 minutes - half an hr later he finally arrived! We had an air-conditioned room which was well furnished and beautifully decorated and had a nice bathroom. The hotel is situated in a great spot - only 5 minutes walk from St Peter's and 3 minutes walk from the metro. Next door to the hotel is a fabulous restaurant that gets quite busy and the locals love to dine in. We felt very welcome there (by the waiters and the chef who always said hello!), the food was excellent (fabulous steaks - they come rare!) and we ate there every night! Unfortunately the breakfast at Hotel Amalia didn't include any meats or cheeses which we usually get when staying in Italy. We booked a taxi with the hotel to take us back to the airport at 8.30am. We waited outside at 8.25am and at 8.45am the receptionist came out to tell us that the taxi wouldn't be here until at least 9.15am due to bad traffic! She wanted us to wait for that taxi (which would have cost 47 euros up front) but we asked her to call us a white cab as we would like to get our flight! It came in 2 minutes, sailed through to the airport in just under 30 mins and cost 30 euros on the meter! Overall we had a fabulous time in Rome with just the taxi problems and not the best breakfast we've ever had! The good outweighed the bad!

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulj
Reviews.Content: We stayed there with 2 children, handy location for the Vatican and Metro close by, with lots of good local restaurants. Very clean and spacious rooms, and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “unfriendly receptionist”
Reviews.Author: missThangNewcastle
Reviews.Content: i ordered an airport pick up arranged by hotel amalia.....which DID NOT turn up. i was staying in rome for 1 night alone with my 10 month old daughter so got a taxi for 40 euros. when i got to the hotel i got no apology from the receptionist she was VERY hostile & seemed to blame me for the driver not turning up, she said "he was there madam" in a nasty tone Got to my room on the top floor no help with the pushchair or my bags even though i asked there was no staff availble to help me even though i was alone with a baby. on the top floor there were work men with loud drilling noises plastic sheets on the floor..TERRIBLE!!!!! i would rather stay in a hotel outside the center of rome then here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cfsnco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Amalia for two nights on 4-6 Jun 05 and found it very good. Check-in was quick. the Hotel arranged for pick-up at the airport and the gentleman was on time coming and going and we paid 47.00 Euros both ways. The elevator was the old fashioned kind with the steel door and it only fitted two people with maybe one suit case. We had to make at least 2 trips because of the all the luggage we had. Again, same here as the the other hotels we stayed at no one offered to take our lugagge up. guess it's an european thing. we occupied 2 rooms, the 501 and the 506. The rooms were extremely clean and ample. AC was very good but you needed to keep the key in the slot in order to keep the lights on. We found this to be true in all the hotels we stayed in. The AC would continue to run however. We were not charged for the use of the hotel safe. In the larger of the rooms that we occupied (501) we had a suite type room which provided a separate living area with a sleeper sofa, T.V. and desk. The bedroom was a queen sized bed that was very comfortable with good sheets and pillows. The bathroom was equally good with plenty of hot water and good pressure. The one room we had faced an inside courtyard with not much of a view, but the other room (506) offered a good view of the street below. If your in Rome; your there to see the sites and not spend your day in the room. Breakfast was seriously lacking. All they had was pastries, cereal and some cofee. The other reviewer might have considered this a great breakfast but even my wife who generally has a light breakfast thought this was really light. I would stay there again but eat Breakfast in the restaurant next door. dinner in the restaurant next door was very good and relatively inexpensive. If your looking to be close to the Vatican you can't do much better than the Amelia; the Vatican being about 2 blocks away.
